snippet: Residents of Jerusalem said Friday that they had felt largely immune from the current military operation, by virtue of the city’s religious sites and its huge Palestinian population. Until they heard the wartime siren blaring.
abstract: Residents of Jerusalem say they had felt largely immune from current military operation in Gaza, by virtue of city’s religious sites and its huge Palestinian population, until they heard the wartime siren blaring.

byline.contributor: Danielle Ziri contributed reporting from Tel Aviv.

lead_paragraph: Residents of Jerusalem said Friday that they had felt largely immune from the current military operation, by virtue of the city’s religious sites and its huge Palestinian population. Until they heard the wartime siren blaring.

headline.seo: Sirens Disrupt the Sabbath in Jerusalem
headline.main: Quiet Arrival of Sabbath in Jerusalem Is Disturbed by Wailing of Wartime Siren
headline.print_headline: Quiet Arrival of Sabbath in Jerusalem Is Disturbed by Wailing of Wartime Siren
